Description:
The FHIR Consent resource defines a concept around collected consent for some action. The Consent.Search interaction returns only metadata about the patient consent document(s) on file, such as the type of consent and the effective period. This resource does not return the consent document itself. Typically this resource is used to check whether a consent document is on file for a particular patient.

The Consent.Search resource can return data about one or more Consent documents that match the search parameters.

Providers can use the Consent resource for all types of consent documents, and patients can look up information on their consent regarding Advance Directives.

This resource respects patient-level break-the-glass checks and document type security checks as configured in Epic. Audit events are logged to the patient audit trail when a consent document is accessed by this resource.
SampleResponse:
<Bundle xmlns="http://hl7.org/fhir">

    <link>

        <url value="https://vs-icx18-25.epic.com/Interconnect-FHIR-CDE-Unsecured/api/FHIR/STU3/Consent?patient=eafUq-Rq7rj37QX5fTQxg9Q3" />

    </link>

    <entry>

        <link>

            <relation value="self" />

            <url value="https://vs-icx18-25.epic.com/Interconnect-FHIR-CDE-Unsecured/api/FHIR/STU3/Consent/eb9ZJOVo4PF4Flx1yBFJSUg3" />

        </link>

        <fullUrl value="https://vs-icx18-25.epic.com/Interconnect-FHIR-CDE-Unsecured/api/FHIR/STU3/Consent/eb9ZJOVo4PF4Flx1yBFJSUg3" />

        <resource>

            <Consent>

                <id value="eb9ZJOVo4PF4Flx1yBFJSUg3" />

                <extension url="http://nictiz.nl/fhir/StructureDefinition/Comment">

                    <valueString value="Description for AD and Living Will" />

                </extension>

                <identifier>

                    <use value="usual" />

                    <system value="urn:oid:1.2.840.114350.1.13.861.1.7.2.686783" />

                    <value value="953903" />

                </identifier>

                <status value="active" />

                <category>

                    <coding>

                        <system value="urn:oid:1.2.840.114350.1.13.861.1.7.4.686783.100" />

                        <code value="10" />

                        <display value="Advance Directives and Living Will" />

                    </coding>

                    <coding>

                        <system value="http://snomed.info/sct" />

                        <code value="11341000146107" />

                    </coding>

                    <text value="Advance Directives and Living Will" />

                </category>

                <patient>

                    <reference value="https://vs-icx18-25.epic.com/Interconnect-FHIR-CDE-Unsecured/api/FHIR/STU3/Patient/eafUq-Rq7rj37QX5fTQxg9Q3" />

                    <display value="Dxl, Test" />

                </patient>

                <dateTime value="2021-06-02T18:51:58Z" />

                <policy>

                    <extension url="http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/data-absent-reason">

                        <valueCode value="unknown" />

                    </extension>

                </policy>

            </Consent>

        </resource>

        <search>

            <mode value="match" />

        </search>

    </entry>

</Bundle>

category.Name: category
category.Description:
The type of consent document. This value follows the specification of the FHIR ConsentCategoryCodes (consent-category) value set, which includes LOINC codes and other identifiers. Additional values can be mapped by Epic organizations if desired.

Supported consent categories include:

  • 59284-0 (Consent Document)
  • 64292-6 (Release of information Consent Document)
  • 84095-9 (Do not resuscitate)
  • 59284-0 (Clinical Consent)
  • 64293-4 (Procedure Consent Document)
  • 61359-6 (Anesthesia Consent Document)
  • 61358-8 (Surgical operation Consent Document)
  • 52027-0 (Abortion Consent Document)
  • 52029-6 (Sterilization Consent Document)
  • 64300-7 (Organ donation Consent Document)
  • 83930-8 (Research Consent Document)

This API also supports SNOMED code 11341000146107-Advance Directive as a category.

patient.Name: patient
patient.Description: FHIR ID for the Patient the consent applies to.
patient.Optional: Either patient or subject must be provided. If both are provided, they must match.

status.Name: status
status.Description:
The state of the consent. This value follows the specification of the FHIR ConsentState value set. The following values have default out-of-the-box support in Epic. Additional statuses can be mapped by Epic organizations if desired.

  • draft
    • Corresponds to Epic value 11-Not Received
  • active
    • Corresponds to Epic values 10-Received and 20-Accepted
  • rejected
    • Corresponds to Epic value 1-Unknown
  • entered-in-error
    • Corresponds to Epic value 35-Error
  • inactive
    • Does not correspond to any Epic value by default
  • proposed
    • Does not correspond to any Epic value by default

Consent documents with no status specified in Epic are returned when searching without a status parameter

subject.Name: subject
subject.Description: FHIR ID for the Patient the consent applies to.
subject.Optional: Either patient or subject must be provided. If both are provided, they must match.

Bundle.Name: Bundle
Bundle.Description: Resource bundle. For more information, refer to the FHIR specification.

entry.Name: entry
entry.Description: A single entry in the resource bundle.

resource.Name: resource
resource.Description: A single resource returned as part of this bundle.

Consent.Name: Consent
Consent.Description: An instance of the R4 Consent resource.

category.Name: category
category.Description:
The type of consent document. This value follows the specification of the FHIR ConsentCategoryCodes (consent-category) value set, which includes LOINC codes and other identifiers. Additional values can be mapped by Epic organizations if desired.

Supported consent categories include:

  • 59284-0 (Consent Document)
  • 64292-6 (Release of information Consent Document)
  • 84095-9 (Do not resuscitate)
  • 59284-0 (Clinical Consent)
  • 64293-4 (Procedure Consent Document)
  • 61359-6 (Anesthesia Consent Document)
  • 61358-8 (Surgical operation Consent Document)
  • 52027-0 (Abortion Consent Document)
  • 52029-6 (Sterilization Consent Document)
  • 64300-7 (Organ donation Consent Document)
  • 83930-8 (Research Consent Document)

This API also supports SNOMED code 11341000146107-Advance Directive as a .

For organizations located in the Netherlands, this API also supports category mapping based on the WilsverklaringTypeCodelijst.

consentingParty.Name: consentingParty
consentingParty.Description:
This element applies only to organizations in the Netherlands. The person who is the legal representative or is appointed as the authorized representative in the signed consent. In Epic, this is represented by the patient’s active Health Care Agent.

If a patient has no active Health Care Agent, this returns the patient’s own name.

profile.Name: profile
profile.Description: Available in Netherlands environments only. This element shows that this API conforms to the profile connected to the following canonical url: http://nictiz.nl/fhir/StructureDefinition/zib-AdvanceDirective

patient.Name: patient
patient.Description: FHIR reference for the Patient the consent applies to.

policy.Name: policy
policy.Description: The policy of the consent document.

status.Name: status
status.Description:
The state of the consent. This value follows the specification of the FHIR ConsentState value set. The following values have default out-of-the-box support in Epic. Additional statuses can be mapped by Epic organizations if desired.

  • draft
    • Corresponds to Epic value 11-Not Received
  • active
    • Corresponds to Epic values 10-Received and 20-Accepted
  • rejected
    • Corresponds to Epic value 1-Unknown
  • entered-in-error
    • Corresponds to Epic value 35-Error
  • inactive
    • Does not correspond to any Epic value by default
  • proposed
    • Does not correspond to any Epic value by default

Consent documents with no status specified in Epic return all statuses.
